| image            = Marc Emery and Jodie Emery.JPG

| caption          = Emery with husband Marc, Toronto Freedom Festival 2010

| death_date       =
| death_place      =
| residence        = [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia|BC]], Canada
| party            = [[Liberal Party of Canada]], <br>[[Green Party of British Columbia|B.C. Green Party]],<br>  [[British Columbia Marijuana Party|B.C. Marijuana Party]]
| nationality      = Canadian
| other_names      = Princess of Pot
| occupation       = Activist, Politician

'''Jodie Emery'''  (born January 4, 1985) is a  [[Canada|Canadian]] [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]] [[Legality of cannabis|activist]], and politician. She is the wife of activist [[Marc Emery]], and co-owner of [[Cannabis Culture (magazine)|Cannabis Culture magazine]], [[Pot TV]], and the retail store ''Cannabis Culture Headquarters''.

She has run a [[Legality of cannabis|cannabis legalisation]] platform in the [[Green Party of British Columbia]], and the [[British Columbia Marijuana Party]], and in 2014 filed a nomination for the federal [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal Party]] in the riding of [[Vancouver East]].<ref name="liberal"/>

She and her husband Marc live in [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]].

==Early life==
Emery grew up in [[Kamloops, BC]], and attended [[St. Michael's University School]] in [[Victoria, British Columbia]].<ref name="jodiemla"/> Emery is a vegetarian,<ref name="princess">{{cite web|title=The princess of pot|url=http://thewalrus.ca/the-princess-of-pot/}}</ref> and former user of cocaine.<ref name="princess"/>
She moved to [[Vancouver]] in 2004. She and Marc Emery married on July 23, 2006.

==Cannabis activism==
As editor of [[Cannabis Culture (magazine)|Cannabis Culture magazine]], she has been active in [[Legality of cannabis|cannabis legalisation]] movements worldwide since 2004.
She participated in marijuana legalization initiatives in California in November 2010 and Washington State in 2012, spoke at [[Moses Znaimer]]'s Idea City conference in June 2012, and the [[New Hampshire Liberty Forum]] in February 2012.<ref name="jodiemla"/>

During her husband's five year incarceration beginning in 2009 in the [[United States]], Emery was active seeking the repatriation of her husband back to Canada.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.orato.com/current-events/2008/01/14/jodie-emery-039-s-prince-pot-negotiates-plea-bargain |title=Post by Jodie Emery |publisher=Orato.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-09}}</ref>

Emery produces a weekly video broadcast called ''The Jodie Emery Show''.

In 2014, Emery appeared in the [[Trailer Park Boys]] film "[[Trailer Park Boys: Don't Legalize It|Don't Legalize It]]".

==Political career==
Emery is a [[libertarianism|libertarian]],<ref name="princess"/> and [[Ayn Rand]] supporter.<ref name="facebook">{{cite web|title=Jodie Emery for Liberal Pary|url=https://www.facebook.com/JodieJEmery/info}}</ref> She is socially left-of-centre and advocates for non-violence, the complete legalization of marijuana, [[electoral reform]] and [[Higher education in Canada|affordable education]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Liberal candidacy - Issues|url=http://jodieemery.ca/category/issues/}}</ref>
She ran for provincial office as a [[British Columbia Marijuana Party|B.C. Marijuana Party]] candidate in 2005, and again in a 2008 by-election.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Princess of Pot - Ideacity conference|url=http://www.ideacityonline.com/speaker/jodie-emery/}}</ref>

She ran as a candidate for the [[Green Party of British Columbia|BC Green Party]] in the [[British Columbia general election, 2009|May 2009 election]],<ref>
{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dhsxEUkovE0 |title=Broadcast Yourself |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2010-08-01}}</ref> coming in third, losing to [[British Columbia Liberal Party|Liberal Party]] member [[Kash Heed]]. She ran again for the Green party in 2013.

She is the BC Green Party's Policing and Crime Critic, and was elected as a Director-At-Large at the 2010 BC Green Party Annual General Meeting.<ref name="jodiemla">{{cite web|url=http://jodieformla.ca/ |title=Jodie Emery for MLA : HomePage |publisher=Jodieformla.ca |date=2013-05-14 |accessdate=2014-06-09}}</ref>

Emery has filed her intention to seek the nomination for the Liberal Party in the riding of [[Vancouver East]], currently held in Parliament by NDP MP [[Libby Davies]].<ref name="liberal">
{{cite web
 |url= http://au.ibtimes.com/articles/565764/20140910/canada-pot-marijuana-cannabis-emery-liberal.htm

 |date= 2014-09-10}}</ref>

 |date= 2014-09-08}}</ref>
